summary: DFC full-system: Node/Express + MySQL web app with client signup/login and session-protected client dashboard (shipments/bills), plus an admin panel with Google Maps live tracking and revenue charts, and WhatsApp support button.
architectural_notes: Backend: Node.js + Express with express-session for auth/session management
Database: MySQL (mysql2) using db.js config module; schema includes users, shipments, bills
Frontend served as static HTML views + CSS in /public
Google Maps JavaScript API used for admin dashboard map (API key required)
Charts.js used for admin dashboard revenue chart
known_issues: Build/deploy attempt failed previously ('AI was unable to implement your request'); needs retry/clean implementation

existing_features.title: Add an Admin Dashboard tab/section for “Live Tracking” that renders a Google Maps view showing all shipments with markers, using a Google Maps JavaScript API key provided via a frontend environment variable (e.g., VITE_GOOGLE_MAPS_API_KEY).
Implement the missing React admin tracking component (currently empty) to power the new “Live Tracking” tab, including loading, empty state, and error UI consistent with the existing admin design.
Add an Admin Dashboard “Revenue” view that renders a line chart of revenue using invoice data already managed in the app, replacing static demo data with computed totals from stored invoices.
Add a persistent “Contact Support via WhatsApp” button/link in the client dashboard UI that opens WhatsApp to the support number 9817783604 with a prefilled English support message.

new_feature_requests.summary: Set up MySQL database connection/config for the DFC system (dfc_db) and make project ready to run
Implement client signup/login with sessions and client dashboard pages (active/delivered shipments, pending bills)
Implement admin login and admin dashboard panel
Add Google Maps integration for admin dashboard live tracking (Google API key + maps.js)
Add Charts.js revenue chart integration in admin dashboard (charts.js)
Add WhatsApp support/contact button to client dashboard

Extend the backend shipment model and APIs to support map rendering by storing coordinates per shipment (latitude/longitude) and exposing an admin-authorized query to fetch all shipments for the tracking map.
